title: Ownership Structure of UnitedHealth Group Inc

content.text:
The major shareholders of UnitedHealth Group Inc include institutional investors and insiders. As of the latest available information, the top institutional shareholders are:
1. Vanguard Group Inc: Owns approximately 8.63% of the company's outstanding shares.
2. BlackRock Inc: Owns approximately 7.27% of the company's outstanding shares.
3. State Street Corporation: Owns approximately 4.99% of the company's outstanding shares.

In addition to Vanguard Group Inc, BlackRock Inc, and State Street Corporation, other significant institutional investors who own shares of UnitedHealth Group Inc include:
1. Fidelity Management & Research Company LLC: Owns approximately 4.33% of the company's outstanding shares.
2. Capital Research Global Investors: Owns approximately 2.82% of the company's outstanding shares.
3. Wellington Management Company LLP: Owns approximately 2.80% of the company's outstanding shares.

Insider ownership in UnitedHealth Group Inc is relatively low. As of the latest available information, insiders collectively own approximately 0.48% of the company's outstanding shares. This includes shares held by executive officers and members of the board of directors.

news.headline: UnitedHealth (UNH) Arm Optum Partners With ProHealth Care
news.summary: Per the deal, more than 800 employees of ProHealth Care are likely to shift to UnitedHealth's (UNH) Optum business.

news.headline: UnitedHealthcare’s Surest Leads to More Preventive Care, Improves Member Satisfaction and Lowers Costs, Data Shows
news.summary: October 05, 2023--The UnitedHealthcare Surest™ health plan, which eliminates deductibles and offers clear upfront pricing information to people in advance of treatment, helps members more frequently access preventive care services and lower out-of-pocket costs, according to recent data.1 At the same time, the data shows employers can reduce health care costs by an average of 15%.2
